text: I am able to adapt when changes occur in my life
I can bounce back after illness, injury, or other hardships
I am able to handle unpleasant or painful feelings like sadness, fear, and anger
I believe I can achieve my goals, even when there are obstacles
I tend to focus on solving problems rather than feeling overwhelmed by them
When things look hopeless, I don't give up
I have close and secure relationships that help me during times of stress
I am comfortable asking for help when I need it
I take action to try to make difficult situations better
I try to come up with a strategy about what to do when facing problems
I try to see stressful situations in a different light, to make them seem more positive
I get emotional support from others when stressed
I learn to live with stressful situations
I give up trying to deal with difficult situations
I refuse to believe that stressful things have happened
I use alcohol or drugs to make myself feel better
I criticize myself for problems or failures
I worry that people close to me will abandon me

text: I experience sudden episodes of intense fear or discomfort that come on quickly and reach a peak within minutes.
During sudden panic episodes, I experience physical symptoms like rapid heartbeat, sweating, trembling, shortness of breath, or chest pain.
I worry about having another panic attack or losing control.
I avoid certain places or situations because I'm afraid I might have a panic attack there.
During panic episodes, I feel like I'm going to die or that I'm having a heart attack.
I feel very anxious or fearful in social situations where I might be judged or evaluated by others.
I worry for days or weeks before a social event that I have to attend.
I avoid speaking up in meetings, classes, or group settings because I'm afraid of embarrassing myself.
After social interactions, I replay them in my mind over and over, analyzing what I said or did wrong.
I am intensely afraid that others will notice my anxiety symptoms (like blushing, sweating, or trembling).
I have unwanted thoughts, images, or urges that repeatedly come into my mind and cause me distress.
I feel driven to perform certain behaviors or mental acts over and over to reduce my anxiety or prevent something bad from happening.
I spend a lot of time each day performing repetitive behaviors or rituals, or trying to suppress unwanted thoughts.
Unwanted repetitive thoughts or behaviors significantly interfere with my daily life, work, or relationships.
I have experienced or witnessed a traumatic event that continues to affect me.
contextMessage: Everyone responds to stress differently. These questions explore how you experience and process stressful situations.

text: How would you rate your energy levels lately?
How satisfied are you with your overall mood lately?
How well have you been sleeping recently?
When something stressful happens, how quickly do you usually bounce back?

options.label: Very slowly - Stress lingers for days/weeks
Moderately - Recovers within a day or two
Very quickly - Bounces back almost immediately

text: How often do you find yourself worrying about things?

options.label: Constantly - Worry almost all the time

text: How comfortable are you making small talk with strangers or acquaintances?

options.label: Neutral - Can manage but don't enjoy it
Very comfortable - Love meeting new people

text: How satisfied are you with your life overall right now?
How interested and engaged do you feel in your daily activities?

options.label: Not interested at all - Everything feels pointless
Moderately interested - Some activities engage me
Very interested - Most activities engage me
Extremely interested - Passionate about daily life

text: How would you rate your overall physical health?

options.label: Very good - Rarely have health issues

text: How easy is it for you to concentrate and stay focused when you need to?

options.label: Very difficult - Can't focus at all
